entry.title: Fwd: [BIP 15] Aliases
entry.summary: The email thread discusses a proposal with standard URLs, which is favored by slush as it is a clear and flexible solution that is easy to implement in clients and can be easily understood by people. Andy Parkins disagrees with the idea of a hard-coded mapping and believes that server operators should have the freedom to arrange their domain names and paths as they wish. DNS is also not considered an ideal technology to use. Amir Taaki clarifies that the intent with the HTTPS proposal is to allow users to contact a bitcoin address via an alias. However, Andy argues that there is no need for an encoding scheme, and URLs can be used instead to provide more flexibility to service providers. The world is already familiar with URLs, and it could be made to detect a browser connecting rather than a bitcoin client, which would benefit from a standards document. In conclusion, the email thread discusses the advantages and disadvantages of using different technologies to implement Bitcoin addresses via aliases.
